data.question: Why does [{3}{Nd(H2O)5}2•(H2O)13]∞ have a higher density compared to [{3}{Yb(H2O)4}2•(H2O)13]∞?
data.answer: Nd has a larger atomic radius than Yb, leading to a denser crystal structure.

data.question: Why is the crystal size of Na4[{Ru(CN)4}2(µ2-HAT)]•8H2O relatively small?
data.answer: The complexation process may result in smaller crystal growth.

data.question: What could be the reason for the difference in molecular weights between [{Yb(H2O)4}{Yb(H2O)6}{Yb(H2O)2(NO3)}{2}2•20(H2O)]∞ and [{3}{Yb(H2O)4}2•(H2O)13]∞?
data.answer: The difference in molecular weights is due to the different number of water molecules and the presence of nitrate ions in the former.

data.question: Why does [{3}{Nd(H2O)5}2•(H2O)13]∞ have a higher µ (mm-1) value compared to other complexes?
data.answer: The higher µ value could be due to the specific arrangement of water molecules and Nd ions in the crystal structure.
